content.description: Starts underclinged with good feet, move up to the rail in the first crack, then gain a high foot and move up to the higher crack, reach jugs at the top and mantle. Fun warm up!
content.location: Starts on the left side of the face, matched on an undercling. Big cracks make obvious holds. Moves up the left side of the face and mantles right above where it starts.

content.description: Starts on the lowest shelf on the right side of the face, sit start(almost a lay-down start, if you can do it without a pad it's a bit easier) and use a right hand up and to the right to get over your left foot, bump left off of tiny sharp crimps to gain a higher right gaston, that leads to the crack rail above. Feels like you're clawing your way up from the depths of Hell.
content.protection: a few pads, the landing drops off.
content.location: On the right side of the face, start left on the lowest shelf, and right hand up to the right on a crimp. Move left to small crimps, then right to a gaston, mantles right above where it starts.
